extendedInfo.description: This unique application is for all students across the world. It covers 224 topics of Total quality management in detail. These 224 topics are divided in 5 units.Each topic is around 600 words and is complete with diagrams, equations and other forms of graphical representations along with simple text explaining the concept in detail.This USP of this application is "ultra-portability". Students can access the content on-the-go from anywhere they like.Basically, each topic is like a detailed flash card and will make the lives of students simpler and easier.Some of topics Covered in this application are:1.	Introduction To Total Quality Management 2.	Historical Evolution Of Total Quality Management3.	Definition Of Quality- Exceptional4.	Definition Of Quality- Perfection Or Consistency5.	Definition Of Quality- Fitness For Purpose6.	Definition Of Quality- Value For Money7.	Definition Of Quality- Transformative8.	Definition Of Quality- Conclusion9.	The Foundation And The Four Sides Of The TQM Pyramid10.	Focus On The Customer And The Employee11.	Focus On Facts For The Quality12.	Continuous Improvements In Quality13.	Everybodyâs Participation For The Quality14.	The Concept Of System15.	Quality Management Systems16.	Joharryâs New Window On Standardization And Causes Of Quality Failures17.	Standardization And Creativity18.	Standardization And Creativity19.	ISO 9000 And BS 5750-A Stepping Stone To TQM20.	Introduction To The Engineer And TQM21.	The Engineer As A Specialist22.	The Failure Of Engineering Educational Systems: The Uk Experience23.	The New Breed Of Engineers24.	Engineers Competences And The Role Of TQM25.	The Evolution Of Engineers For TQM26.	The Engineer In A TQM Environment27.	How Old Is The Quality Concept28.	Why Are The Japanese Leading The Field Of Quality?29.	How The West Has Woken Up To The Importance Of Quality30.	W E Deming31.	Joseph M Juran32.	Philip B Crosby33.	Armand V Feingenbaum34.	Bill Conway35.	Kaoru Ishikawa36.	Genichi Taguchi37.	Shigeo Shingo38.	W G Ouchi39.	The New Management Model Is Customer Driven40.	Focusing On Systems Thinking41.	Using The Baldrige Criteria To Assess Quality42.	Quality Improvement Increases Profitability43.	Models Of Excellence In Leadership44.	Leading The Transition45.	Expressing Your Company\'S Values46.	Improving As A Leader47.	The Shift In Thinking48.	Model Of Excellence In Customerâs Focus49.	Identifying Your Customers50.	Determining Customer Requirements51.	Using Customer Satisfaction To Drive Your Business52.	The Shift In Thinking In Customer Focus53.	The Background To The European Quality Award54.	The Model For The European Quality Award55.	Assessment Criteria For The Model For The European Quality Award56.	Experiences Of The European Quality Award57.	The Quality Story58.	The Seven Tools For Quality Control59.	Check Sheets60.	The Pareto Diagram61.	The Cause-And-Effect Diagram And The Connection With The Pareto Diagram And Stratification62.	Histograms63.	Control Charts64.	Control Charts65.	Control Charts 66.	Control Charts 67.	Control Charts68.	Control Charts69.	Scatter Diagrams And The Connection With The Stratification Principle70.
